results.title: The Face of Italy
results.creator_credit: Austin Steele and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Italy is a country steeped deep in the cultural riches of an ancient land juxtaposed with the cosmopolitan chic of the new. Her cities, equally important in their contribution to Italy’s cultural tapestry, have played host to many world events, and 1990 is no exception when twelve of them host soccer’s premier competition, the World Cup. Features : Rome, Naples, Bari, Genoa, Florence and Verona. Presented by Les Murray.

results.title: The Face of Britain
results.brief_description: Documentary interpreting the impact on Britain on unplanned industrial development and the prospect of improvements in the future. Soundtrack and editing are used for emotional impact and include segments of “concrete music”.

results.title: The F-111 story
results.brief_description: The development of the F-111 airplane with its controversial variable swing wing construction. A pioneer in aircraft design…shows scenes of flight testing, and demonstrations of this aircraft’s capabilities.

results.title: The Eye: an inside story
results.brief_description: Reveals the various parts of the eye and the functions of each part, as well as showing the mechanics of this complex organ and how the phenomenon of vision is accomplished. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Expressionist eye
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Australian National Gallery and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Australian eye IV”.
Recollections of Melbourne in the 1940s. Examines the rise of artists: Arthur Boyd, Josl Bergner, Joy Hester, Sidney Nolan, John Perceval, Albert Tucker Danila Vassilief, John Reed, Peter Herbst, Barrett Reid and Bernard Smith. This film provides an understanding of that rebellious period when the course of Australian art took a new direction under European Expressionism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Australian National Gallery and Film Australia

results.title: The Explorer
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Albert Tucker (1914-) is an intellectual artist with great independence of mind and mental courage. He has succeeded in fashioning a distinctive style and is now one of the leading artists in Australia. This film is based on a series of paintings by Tucker which deals with an unnamed explorer who perished in the outback desert. Imaginative paintings in an imaginative film.

results.title: The Expanding universe of sculpture
results.brief_description: Explores contemporary sculpture, using as examples works by artists, Reuben Nakina, Alex Leberman, David Burt, and Doris Chase who express their attitudes toward their work and the philosophy that motivates them. Includes a multi-media show which combines music, dance, light and sculpture and demonstrates the uses of a wide variety of materials.
